intro: Yermoloffia insignis, commonly known as the desert dandelion, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of North America. It is characterized by its basal rosette of gray-green, hairy leaves and produces yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments with deep taproots that allow it to access groundwater. Its flowers are pollinated by insects, and the plant produces small, wind-dispersed seeds. Yermoloffia insignis is often found in disturbed soils and is considered an indicator species of degraded habitats.
